citation.article-title: Paenibacillus tundrae sp. nov. and Paenibacillus xylanexedens sp. nov., psychrotolerant, xylan-degrading bacteria from Alaskan tundra
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus xylanexedens sp. nov.
Paenibacillus xylanexedens (xy.lan.ex.e′dens. N.L. n. xylanum xylan; L. v. exedere to eat up, utilize; N.L. part. adj. xylanexedens xylan-utilizing).
Cells are motile rods that grow aerobically or anaerobically.
Optimum temperature for growth is 23 °C (range 13–32 °C) and the optimum pH for growth is 6.0 (range 5.7–8.8).
Variable production of acetone and acetic acid as end products of glucose fermentation.
MK-7 is the major isoprenoid quinone and anteiso-C15 : 0 is the major fatty acid.

Utilizes adenosine, α-cyclodextrin, β-cyclodextrin, dextrin, amygdalin, arbutin, d-cellulose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, lactose, lactulose, maltose, maltotriose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, melibiose, methyl α-d-galactosidase, methyl β-d-galactosidase, 3-methyl d-glucose, methyl β-d-glucoside, palatinose, d-psicose, raffinose, salicin, stachyose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, pyruvic acid, glycerol, inosine, glycogen, pyruvic acid methyl ester and uridine as sole carbon sources.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 46.4 mol% (Tm).
The type strain of Paenibacillus xylanexedens is B22aT (=NRRL B-51090T=DSM 21292T).
